intro: Calibrachoa micrantha, commonly known as the dwarf petunia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, tomatoes, and potatoes. This species is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to violet. Calibrachoa micrantha thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its compact growth habit and vibrant blooms make it an ornamental plant valued in horticulture.
